interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Inkheart (+ BD-Live) [Blu-ray]
Review Date: 2013/10/29
Store: Brendan Fraser  (Actor),     Paul Bettany  (Actor),     Iain Softley  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    PG    Format: Blu-ray
Categories: Movies & TV, Today's Deals, Featured Deals & New Releases, The Big DVD & Blu-ray Blowout
Product Description: ['Inkheart (Blu-ray)', 'When Mo Folchart reads a story, the characters leap off the page. Literally. And that’s a problem. Mo must somehow use his special powers to send the interlopers back to their world…and save ours. If ever a task was easier read than done, this is it. Mo and his daughter Meggie, aided by friends real and fictional, plunge into a thrilling quest that pits them against diabolical villains, fantastic beasts and dangers at every turn. Brendan Fraser (The Mummy films, Journey to the Center of the Earth) leads a splendid cast (including Academy Award winners* Helen Mirren and Jim Broadbent) in an all-fun, all-family film of Cornelia Funke’s bestseller. Follow Mo and Meggie into adventure more exciting than any ever read. Because it’s adventure they’re going to live!', ']]>']
Average Rating: 4.7
Product Details: {'Genre': 'Science Fiction & Fantasy, Kids & Family, Action & Adventure', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Blu-ray, Color, Dolby, Special Edition, Widescreen, Subtitled', 'Contributor': 'Rafi Gavron, Eliza Hope Bennett, Brendan Fraser, Andy Serkis, Jim Broadbent, Helen Mirren, Iain Softley, Paul Bettany, Sienna GuilloryRafi Gavron, Eliza Hope Bennett, Brendan Fraser, Andy Serkis, Jim Broadbent, Helen Mirren, Iain Softley, Paul Bettany, Sienna Guillory  See more', 'Language': 'German (Dolby Digital 5.1), English (Dolby Digital 5.1), English (Dolby TrueHD 5.1)', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 46 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '2.40:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG (Parental Guidance Suggested)', 'Package Dimensions': '6.7 x 5.3 x 0.5 inches; 3.2 Ounces', 'Director': 'Iain Softley', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Blu-ray, Color, Dolby, Special Edition, Widescreen, Subtitled', 'Run time': '1 hour and 46 minutes', 'Release date': 'June 23, 2009', 'Actors': 'Brendan Fraser, Paul Bettany, Helen Mirren, Jim Broadbent, Andy Serkis', 'Dubbed': 'English, German', 'Subtitles': 'English, Spanish, German', 'Studio': 'New Line Home Entertainment', 'Number of discs': '1'}
Review Text: I watched this movie with some trepidation since Brandon Frazier has not had good reviews in a long time. What I got was a good cohesive story with enough mystery that if it had been a book I would have continued turning the pages until I learned all of its secrets. There were some scenes that just went to fast and I felt like there could have been more there. The Blu-ray has lots of features that make this worth owning, the menus are exquisite and painstakingly down, superb work.
Review Title: A real surprise
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
reference_summary:
{'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Brad Bird'], 'Producers': ['Tom Cruise', 'J.J. Abrams', 'Bryan Burk'], 'Starring': ['Tom Cruise', 'Jeremy Renner', 'Simon Pegg'], 'Studio': ['Hit Movies']} When my Blu-Ray Disc from netflix wouldn't play I turned to streaming and grabbed this movie. The stream ran without any real buffering and I was happy with bitrate, picture and sound.
The movie itself, is enjoyable with good plot points and action
There are several plot holes and continuity errors- pretty standard for action movies and Tom Cruise's performance is not as good as it could be.
The script is tight but does not grab your emotions very firmly. The supporting cast is really what makes up for any lack you feel in the tug of the plot or main character.
Overall I enjoyed it. Not enough to want to own it or even watch it again unless it was on TV and the choice came down to it and Duck Dynasty. Better than I expected {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Constantine Makris', 'Matt Earl Beesley', 'Jamie Babbit', 'Ed Bianchi', 'Stephen Hopkins'], 'Producers': ['Bob DeLaurentis', "Peter O'Fallon", 'Noah Hawley'], 'Studio': ['ABC Network']} I had my doubts, but I loved the cast pretty much from the get go. The show has smart dialogue and crazy "night court" plot twists. The surprise of the show is while you are looking for humor and actionb you are getting emotion from the acting and situations. It's not melodrama as much as you start to care for the characters even the ones who have despicable pasts. I would highly recommend this show if you like The Glades, or The Finder this is a fresh show filled with smart humor Inkheart (+ BD-Live) [Blu-ray] Brendan Fraser (Actor), Paul Bettany (Actor), Iain Softley (Director) & 0 more Rated: PG Format: Blu-ray Movies & TV, Today's Deals, Featured Deals & New Releases, The Big DVD & Blu-ray Blowout ['Inkheart (Blu-ray)', 'When Mo Folchart reads a story, the characters leap off the page. profile:
**User Profile Summary:**

- **Media Consumption Preference:** Enjoys streaming movies and shows, with a particular interest in the action genre and films featuring compelling and engaging plots. The user has recently demonstrated an appreciation for narratives that balance humor and emotional depth, indicating a strong preference for character-driven content.

- **Content Sensitivity:** The user favors mature themes, including moderate violence and mild language, reflecting a sophisticated viewing style. Open to complex plot developments, they appreciate emotional situations that can arise in lighthearted contexts.

- **Performance Evaluation:** Values solid performances from both lead and supporting actors, with a notable appreciation for well-crafted dialogue and character arcs. Their latest review highlights a surprise enjoyment of a film, emphasizing narrative coherence and engaging mystery.

- **Engagement Level:** While the user enjoys streaming media, they are selective about physical ownership, preferring content that has substantial replay value. They are inclined towards accessible viewing options like television reruns and shows that combine humor with action.

- **Overall Satisfaction:** Maintains a generally positive experience with media consumption, prioritizing production quality and emotional resonance. Their critical eye for coherence and depth aligns with their thoughtful engagement, as evidenced by recent ratings and reviews.

**Trend Indicators:** 
- An increasing interest in narrative complexity and character development, coupled with a continued focus on technical proficiency in both streaming media and physical formats.
